metadata.title: CVE-2022-20141 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
In ip_check_mc_rcu of igmp.c, there is a possible use after free due toimproper locking. This could lead to local escalation of privilege whenopening and closing inet sockets with no additional execution privilegesneeded. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.Product:AndroidVersions: Android kernelAndroid ID: A-112551163References: Upstreamkernel

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-20141` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-230-generic - 4.4.0-230.264
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-230-generic - 4.4.0-230.264
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-230-lowlatency - 4.4.0-230.264
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-162-generic - 4.15.0-162.170~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-162-generic - 4.15.0-162.170~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-162-lowlatency - 4.15.0-162.170~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1111-kvm - 4.4.0-1111.121
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1146-aws - 4.4.0-1146.161
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-1115-aws - 4.15.0-1115.122~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1126-azure - 4.15.0-1126.139~16.04.1

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1111-gcp - 4.15.0-1111.125~16.04.1

criterions.comment: linux package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-230.264').
linux-hwe package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-162.170~16.04.1').

linux-oracle package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1083.91~16.04.1').
